author: norswap
content:
zk-rollups just need to post zk proofs on L1, not the full list on transaction - this takes (much) less space, hence it's cheaper
on the flip side, zksync todays does not handle Solidity smart contracts (only those written in Zinc, which does not compile to EVM)
zksync 2.0 will enable EVM/Solidity support.

Though it's never going to be a seamless transition for zk-rollups as far as I understand -- a fundamental limitation of the technology is that all loops have to be bounded, i.e. take a compile-time constant number of iterations. This looks like a pretty big limitation in practice, but there might be ways around it?

content: You still need to publish transaction data for a zk rollup, otherwise users may not be able to reconstruct the rollup state in case the operator disappeared.
